text: Bottle 33cl a cloudy orange beer with medium head. Nose is on brett and orange notes. Aroma is near an orval with even more bretts, barnyards notes, wet wood, peppery hops, bit lambic like

33 cl bottle - bottled on 11 februari 2016
First impression; a real gusher. Its been a while since I had so much foam. Taste is refreshing, would recommend it for thirst quenching purposes.

bottle from boxbeers cloudy orange, small white head.

Very floral and fruity (mangos) aroma, with a big dose of brett. Very fresh and fruity, i really like this surprising mix between mangos and brett. Flavor is quite malty, with bretty notes, dry, also some fruity notes, honey-watermelon perhaps, and hoppy floral flavors.

A Pretty special beer, i dont remember having tasting anything quite like this.

UPDATED: MAY 27, 2017 May 2016 bottling reviewed one year old, pours hazed amber with a tall and sticky head, just barely crawling up out of the bottle when the cap is removed. Funky, buggy, nearly acetic apple-like (malic) brett impression, covering dense orange and apricot fruitiness.   Its medium-light bodied, lightly sweet with some low acidity, more tart and musty across the middle turning slightly sour in a wet finish. It seems to have survived out one year, no surprise given what it is, but still too much of this green apple and white vinegar resemblance, which thankfully subsides as it warms in the glass, the aroma showing more cork and old books / leather. Theres still plenty of sugar left but the carbonation is a mess, over-effervescing right out of the bottle (which comes across as disjointed / loose), before settling out in the glass after a couple of minutes, where its richness and sweetness overtake the diminished CO2 making it feel weighty. Fresh pours have more pizzazz and brighter carbonic acid.

From Hoppy House in BLA :: 02 Bot: 06JUL16 >> Son beau corps orangé au col mince et persistant offre à la décapsule de sublimes senteurs caramélisées et biscuitées aux brett, et fruitées à labricot avec une amertume moyenne. Son attaque ronde tout en équilibre avec les brett douce aérienne et soyeuse, mais sans sucrosité, tapisse tout le palais davant en arrière en impactant toutes les papilles avec des saveurs aigre-douces surettes, comme sil nexistait aucun milieu de bouche, ni finale bien marquée si ce nest, et à condition de bien la laisser souvrir, un retour lointain de saveurs vineuses et barriquées sur des notes de raisin, de groseille et de rhubarbe. Par contre, lamertume bien présente soutient avec bonheur cette arrière-bouche interminable. Une acidité bien maîtrisée, un maltage soutenu et un amertume bien présente font de cette bière un produit de 1er ordre. #400
Bottle from Geers. Hazy colour, white foam. Dry, bitter and grassy beer. Bretty notes. Fruity, dry and easy drinkable. Nice.

33cl bottles bottled DEC2016, Miorge. - Bref: a felicitous stab at unifying an instantly-bretty baby Orval with dry De La Senne sessionability. - Quite massive, denser than Orval, Orval brett in aroma: condensed musty orange peel, sun-ripe haystack and yeast spice such as cardamom, green pepper and cinnamon. Understated grainy sourness blends together the earthy wet pasture bitters: rained-on grasses and forgotten baskets of pears, apples and tangerines. Oddly "copper"-malty despite the brett, vivid carbo and dryness. Instant DLS classic, to be revisited parallel to aged Orval.

33cl Bottle from De Bierkoning. Hazy deep golden colour, white head. Aroma of loads of Brett funk, poo, barn, light malty. Flavour is light cheesy, malty, Brett funk, light nutty, hay, light fruity, dry bitter finish. Light bodied. Nice, but rather strong on the Brett.

Bottle.Hazy yellow colour with white head.Aroma is nice of yeast and fruits most like is peach and citrus,bready and hoppy with medium body and light fresh taste well balanced and slight tart but overall good by style.

Bottle, pours hazy orange gold with a foamy white head. Aroma is light, doughy malt, spice, Brett, floral hop, orange peel, pineapple and strawberry. Nicely complex with great balance. Light body, lively carbonation, finish is dry and bitter.
Pungent aroma that contrasts taste, which features white wine and olives on top of the expected brett features, perfect mouthfeeel

Bouteille de 330 ml dégustée au Pub Pit Caribou (Montréal, QC) au coût de 11,00$. Arôme: Odeur de brett et de fruité. Apparence: La couleur est blonde-orangée opaque. Présence dun mince col mousseux et dune fine dentelle sur le verre. Saveur: Goût doranges et de brett avec une pointe de poires. Durée moyenne de larrière goût. Palette: Le corps est moyen avec une texture légèrement onctueuse. Moyenne effervescence en bouche. Présence de brett en arrière goût. (Rating #7658)

Bottle from Redmonds. Massive Belgian aroma - lots of brett, lots of spice and fruit. Very complex: flavour profile changes really quickly in the mouth, when the fruitiness (which is big) fades, some sour beer qualities arrive, and it ends on a beery-savoury note.
Yeasty and funky aromas and tastes with long tart finish. Nicely carbonated for such a sour
Bottle. Hazy amber, offwhite head. Bretty aroma, fruity and malty. Flavour has solid brett and juicy citrus. Fluffy carbonation. A little yeasty roughness and sweetness in the finish. Very nice.

My Bottom Line:
Earthy, coniferous wilderness meets oranges and flowers in this spritzy Wild Ale.

Further Personal Perceptions:
-A sheet of foam laces atop the cloudy pale amber.
-Complexity and drinkability are rarely as good friends as they are in this one.
-A soapy touch seems to come from the floral bouquet.
-This might be even more pleasant (and drinkable) than Orval. Will have to try them on the same day next time.

Bottle.
Bottle. Pours hazy orange with a medium white head. Aromas of brett, citrus, peach, orange, light wheat, esters. Taste is bretty as fuck, dry grassy, tangerine, orange, citrus, hay, wheat.
Bottle thanks to klim. Pours hazy orange with a off white head. Aroma of Brett, pear, sweet esters, mandarin and stable. Taste of Brett, citrus, sweet estery notes, stable, hay and orange Peel.
Bottle thanks to klimaet. Aroma of fruity, citrus brett, yeasty leather. Hazy golden with white head. Taste is dry and light sour. Light body, dry oily feel and bretty sour feel.

14-APR-2017, bottle from Arnes in Westmarket.
Slight gusher.
Hazy orange with a lasting, low, white head.
Aroma is huge brett. Some fruity, malty notes underneath but mostly brett.
Taste is the same. Very funky. Over carbonated, medium body, very dry. Nice one:-)
330ml bottled 2016-07-06. Hazy hay stack small white foam. Aroma of barn and yeast. Taste Belgian yeast. Medium body and carbo for the style. Medium brett and long belgian yeast finish.
Bottle, 330 ml at Nüetnigenough, Bruxelles. Pours clear golden orange, large white head. Funky, brett, bit sourish, fruit, smooth, low carbonation. Bitter dry finish. Medium bodied.

33 cl. bottle at home. Bought at Arnes Bottleshop, WestMarket. Very high and long lasting creamy white head. Hazy amber body. I did not pour the beer violently but in spite of that I had to wait too long for the head to fall to a sensible level. Dusty cardboard straw barn brett aroma with fruiy hints. Brett dominated fruity flavor. Far from the acidic stuff I had expected. Actually the beer seems very dusty and cardboard like. Little hops bitterness, low carbonation, short finish. Alcohol well hidden thouh.

Bottle, 6.5%. Hazy amber/orange with big tan head. Aroma is malt, fruit, brett, caramel and a little perfume. Flavour is malt, brett, caramel, medium sweet, fruit peel, little funky, little over carbonated, medium bitter and medium dry.

Bottle sample at a tasting at Liors place. Thanks to who. Cloudy orange with soapy off-white head, gusher. The aroma has notes of brett, fruity (peach, pear), some funkiness. The flavor has lots of brett, very fruity, spicy, sweet and bitterish, slightly dry. Medium-bodied.

Bottle at L42, thanks to Matteo. It pours cloudy golden - amber with a massive off-white head. The aroma is fresh bread, earthy, straw, cereal, nougat, leather and light spice. The taste is crisp, bitter, fresh, cereal, wood, bread, nougat, soft stone fruits, earth and a touch of citrus. Medium body and moderate+ foamy carbonation. Drinks easy, but there is not a lot going on.

0,33l bottle at home courtesy of Saeglopur, big thanks. Bottled 11. Feb 2016, BB 11 Feb 2021. big gusher this one. amber cloudy color, rather big white head. smells of fruits, peach, spices, bretty, light funk, peppery, light sweetness. very nice smell. because of the gushing only gets a 2 in appearance (it wouldnt even stop foaming even after I poured the first glass). full body, soft carbonation, slick mouthfeel. tastes fruity, peppery, spices, lightly grassy, light sweetness, light peach, bit citric, bretty. finishes rather dry with notes of grass, brett, light caramel and some fruity notes. very lovely beer, very nice complexity, great balance. I didnt care so much for the strong gushing, but overall very nice beer.
Bottle from Hopology, Nottingham. Hazy golden colour with a thick white head. Aroma is light bret, yeasty, and a touch of tropical fruit. Taste is floral light sweet, and yeasty.

Bottle (33 cl) from Etre Gourmet. Clear amber, medium off-white head. Bready and earthy aroma, some brett phenols, some Senne phenols, and herbal hops. Medium bodied, medium carbonation. Dry, medium to high bitterness.
Bottle. orange colour with white head. Fruity and brett aroma. Sweet, fruity, brett, wood taste. Medium body.

9th February 2017Level 42 Bottleshare. Thanks to Daniel. Hazy gold beer, small pale cream colour head. Palate is airy and softish, modest carbonation. Bitterish savoury brett. Ripe and musty fruits. Dried fruits. Smooth finish. Okay. Top 50? Cough!

Beeroda.hu x Cake&Beer Tasting Sessions @ Budapest, Hungary. // Aroma of light fruit, mild apples, green grapes, hay. Taste is crisp, mild tart with a funky finish. Light and smooth body with soft carbonation.

Avant de commencer ce commentaire de dégustation, une précision simpose. Je suis un fervent opposant de la prédominance de lacidité dans la bière (et dans toute boisson dailleurs). Lacidité ne connaît pas la nuance et va empêche le développement des autres arômes. Pour certains cela leur rappellera éventuellement lenfance et les bonbons acidulés, mais cela ne fera jamais de grande bière. Dailleurs, aucun grand chef ne travaille uniquement sur lacidité. Celle-ci devant être utilisée seulement avec parcimonie pour devenir un exhausteur de goût et donner un peu de peps. Ayant compris que les levures de type Brett étaient bien trop puissantes pour respecter lamertume et le malt, la brasserie de la Senne a apparemment cherché quelque temps (notamment en coopération avec Cantillon) avant de découvrir par le biais dun brassin amateur, cette souche de levure Brett plus respectueuse des arômes. Doù lespoir que je mettais en cette bouteille. Espoir vite corrodé par la dégustation qui finit dans un bain dacide ayant anesthésié ma bouche. En verre, il ny a rien à reprocher cependant. Un blond abricot voilé (EBC au alentours de 25) avec une mousse blanc cassé; très généreuse et crémeuse de deux centimètres environ. Leffervescence est quant à elle très marquée avec de très fines bulles. Concernant le nez, si je souhaitais être correct, je dirais quil est bien entendu sur lacide avec des notes de lambic et de cidre. Mais, force est de constater que celui sapparente à certains détergent pour toilettes. Lattaque et la seconde bouche nous laisseront un peu de répit. Celles-ci étant plutôt bien équilibrées avec une acidité contenue permettant aux autres arômes de marquer leur présence. Ainsi, la première bouche présente une bel équilibre malt/houblon/acidité sur des arômes de pomme, et la seconde bouche, plus maltée laissera sexprimer des notes de caramel, dabricot et de poire avec une arrière bouche sur lamertume. La suite? Un vaste champ de bataille où lacidité ravage tout sur son passage et une subtilité des arômes annihilée (sur une bonne longueur en bouche que lon regrette, une fois nest pas coutume). Une conclusion : un bon détergeant! (et grosse déception venant de la brasserie De la Senne)

February 2017 - Bottle share at One Canada Square, with big thanks to Matteo. As De la Senne Bruxellensis. Matte orange, hazy, murky, lightly sparkling, big dense foamy off-white head. Aroma is bretty, airy, lemongrass, leaves. Body is light, tingly carbonation, frothy. Taste is lemongrass, elderflower, chalky dry finish, some Shake n Vac. Alright. (3.4)

33cl bottle shared in CW. Sourced via Etre. It pours a hazed golden color with a medium off white head. Aroma is medium sweet and medium funky with some Brett and stone fruit. Taste is also medium sweet and medium dry funky with more Brett and citrus peel. Medium bodied with good carbonation. Overall, ok

Bottle split at L42, thanks to Daniel, 09/02/17.
Hazed orange with a well appointed off white cap.
Nose is bitter orange, spice, peach, apricot, yeast esters, straw.
Taste comprises light funk, barnyard, orange peel, damp hay, wood must, apricot tang, wooded notes.
Medium bodied, fine carbonation, drying close.
Decent Belgo affair.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: Bottle shared on Level 42 09/2017. Many thanks to Matteo for this one. A hazed golden orange coloured pour with a lasting thin off white head. Aroma is bretty spicy lemon, orange, tangerine, hint of perfume. Flavour is composed of pear, frothy malts, bretty funk, pineapple, funk. Palate is frothy, abrasive carbonation. Good.

Bottle. Dark orange color with big white head. Aroma is bretty, candy, touch of soap, hoppy, like a young Orval. Taste is very bretty, dry, woody, a bit floral hops and fruit flavours (pineapple, mango). High carbonation. Very nice beer, Id like to see how this ages.

Like the little brother of Orval, Id say. Enjoyed this one a lot. Aromas and taste of camphor, a bit of pepper, slight clove, warming to cidre, vineyard peach, unripe apricots and barnyard. Tastes sweeter than expected with aromas of Marillen/Mirabellen and some tiny abv fumes. Another great beer from de la Senne!

Slightly hazy orange, big white head.
Weirdly I always felt like I smelled Rodenbach in the aroma? 
Taste sweet and bitter notes and something unknown to me maybe what other contributors name funky? 
Dry finish.
More please ;-)
Jan 2017 - Barnyard and grass aromas with grain silo and fermenting taste. Quite nice palate.

Bottled. Pours hazy deep golden with an average, lacing off-white head. Aroma of yeast, citrus, apricot.and caramel notes. Sweet flavor that ends up dry and quite bitter. Medium bodied, oily texture and soft carbonation. A delicious Ale indeed. 🌟🌟🌟🌟

Zeer mooie gistig aroma die heel fijn doorwerkt in de smaak. Een mooi rond hop in de smaak, rood fruit, hazelnoot en leer. Heel veel smaak voor de 6,5% alcohol. Mooie bittere licht wrange afdronk. De beste de la senne.

33 cl bottle. Hazy orange juice colour with nice small, lasting white head. Pungent aroma of horse, grass, pepper and grapefruit. Flavour is citrus fruits, grassy with intense low bitterness. Quite pleasant.

Bottle from Tidens Farver, Aarhus. Hazy orange with a lasting off-white head. Aroma is sweet, malty, fruity and bretty. Flavor is quite sweet and moderate acidic. Dry and moderate acidic finish. Carbonation is a bit high. 170117

Pours hazy gold into a tulip. Bright white head with excellent retention recedes leaving scant sheets. Band aid and aspirin aromas. Sharp with funky band aid, leather and aspirin upfront turning to bitter earth in the lasting finish. Yummy.

Bottle. Hazy effervescent golden with a large frothy off white head with good retention, lace and regeneration. Bretty nose with barnyard, some flowers, minerals, light citrus, mild dark wood and pepper. Smells great. The flavour is dominated by brett with band aid, barnyard, leather. Some light wood and dry grass. Medium body, mild sweet and bitter with a dry bretty finish. Good.
Bottle. Hazy orange, bubbly white head. Aroma malts, pineapple. Taste follows, bringing sweet caramel and fruity tones.

Bottle at home. Clear dark golden with big fluffy white head. Pineapple, some mango, hay, sweaty Brett, funk, light apricot, quite grassy too. Under medium sweet and light bitter. Medium bodied with fizzy carbonation. Very good.

Bottle from Rehills, Newcastle. Hazy golden coloured with a very large white head of foam. It has a herbal lemon and spicy earthy flavour with vanilla and leather notes on the slight tart finish. Excellent!

Drunk from 33cl bottle bought from the Malting Pot in Brussels. Enjoyable, hoppy pale ale. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle 330ml. @ home. [ As De la Senne Bruxellensis ].[ Trade by Dedollewaitor ]. Clear medium orange color with a average, frothy, good lacing, mostly lasting, off-white head. Aroma is moderate malty, pale malt, fruity malt, moderate heavy hoppy, citrus, fruity hops, moderate grapefruit, moderate yeasty, leather, brett, fruity yeast, funky. Flavor is moderate to heavy sweet and bitter with a long duration, leather - brett, hoppy, fruity hops, peach - tropcical fruit, dry, funky. Body is medium, texture is oily to watery, carbonation is soft. [20161227]
 8-4-8-4-17

En bouteille, joliment ambrée avec levure visible. Au nez, légèrement surette. Attaque en bouche fruitée. Ronde avec amertume prononcée qui se termine dans une douceur légèrement caramelisee. Bière très équilibrée et fraîche mais sans grande surprise pour cette brasserie.
Bue en bouteille de 33cl. Comme on pouvait sy attendre, nez levuré, palais légèrement acide avec un gros coté wild. Levure finale, ensemble sympa, plutôt léger, finale amère.
330ml bottle. Pours cloudy orange with a frothy white head. Aroma: fruity, yeasty, funky, barnyard. Taste: sour fruits, berries, citrus, funk, yeast. Dry finish, light bitterness, light carbonation.

330ml bottle from the Brewdog Online Shop. Pours hazy golden with a thin white head. Strong brett aromas, funky, barnyard. Also lots of fruit behind that, pineapple. Taste is dry, tart, funky, fruity. Dry finish. Decent.

09/12/2016 @home - 33cl bottle from Malts Attacks
Cloudy orange with medium white head. Nose is sour, funky, citrus. Taste is sour, funky, citrus, some bitterness. Nicely refreshing!

330ml bottle from Brewdog Edinburgh. 
Small white head, great lacing. Slightly hazy orange body. Yeasty nose, some citrus coming through. Flavour is bread, toast, yeast. Light carbonation, good foamy mouthfeel.

Orange, nearly white head. 
Peach, pineapple, citrus, just a hint of funkiness. 
Dry, slightly sour, refreshing.

Bottle at Moeder Lambic Fontainas. Pours lightly hazy orange with a large, frothy white head, long retention with good lacing. Aroma is moderate funky farmhouse and horse blanket yeast, phenols, light earthy and spicy hops with cracker malt. Flavor is medium earthy and spicy hops and bitterness, bandage phenols, crisp cracker malt, moderate funky farmhouse and horse blanket yeast with a dry finish. Medium body and moderate carbonation.

Smells like soft floral peach blossoms. Hazy orange with active but settles head. Amazing soft woody light tart hints of light fruity blossoms. Great medium body. Perfect balance great slight spice finish.
Bottle @ home, from Dranken Geers. Light hazy copper pour with a frothy light head. Notes of fruity esters, ripe apples, fruit salad, light yeast, sweet and some stone fruit. Pretty good!

Bottle, 06.07.2018 (from etre gourmet). Wants to climb out of the bottle after opening. Pours dark golden-amber with whiteish head. Aroma is fruity, bretty, medicinal, some fruits, citrus. Flavor is sweet and bitter, fruity, medicinal, fruits, citrus, pineapple. Carbonation is on the lower side. Finish is nice fruity and dry. Overall: very good, reminds me Orval.
Pours hazy orange with fairly tall white head. Aroma of light fruit, mild apples, green grapes, hay. Taste is crisp, mild tart with a funky finish. Light and smooth body with soft carbonation.

330ml bottle @ Chez Sophie. Pours a misty pale yellow, large white head. Aroma is floral brett. High carbonation on the palate with fuzzy floral brett taking the reigns. Bears more than a passing resemblance to Orval, exceptionally well balanced. The best De La Senne Ive tried so far.

Bottle from Dranken Geers, Oostakker, Nr Gent, Belgie consumed at home Sunday 27th November 2016   Pours hazy orange gold with a white head. Wow this really is the closest beer tastewise to Orval that Ive ever had. Dry, funky, fruity and with a wonderful tang, the hoppiness is there but in a very different way. Lovely, Loz is hugely impressed.  A7 A4 T8 P4 Ov16 3.9

Troebel donkerblond/amberkleurig bier en ecru schuimkraag met grote bellen. Geur: gist, granen, peperig, hoppig, iets zoetig en fruitig. Smaak: bitter, licht zurig, fruitig. Goede koolzuurprikkel. Aangenaam mondgevoel. Afdronk: licht bitter. Leuke twist met de Brettanomyces zonder "wild" te zijn. Lekker.
hazy golden to orange colour moderate sized off-white head, aroma of leather, barnyard, floral and fruity notes, taste is the same; good Belgian ale

330mL bottle, bottled in February in 2016. Been sitting on the self of State Line Liquors for a few months. Well, that turned this bottle into a brett bomb, just what I was hoping for. Pop the cap and at first it doesnt look like a gusher. But after a few moments it start foaming up the neck. The St. Louis flute glass wasnt prepared for this mess. Had to get a second glass but that wasnt enough. It wasnt a furious gusher but a slow and consistent gush. This lead to a big head and a sticky, foamy lacing. A dim golden, slightly hazy color. Aroma is brett-brux-irific. Still some swet Belgian biscuit malt and a really farmhouse herbal cobwebs. And the herbal brett hasnt turned bitter. A lovely still sweet and bretty aroma. Flavor is malty without the sweetness I get in the aroma. Then a drying bretty herbalness takes over and takes you into the aftertaste and farther. A soft mouthfeel that surrounds the carbonation that tickles the palate lightly. At 6.5% this falls into a nice middle ground between Allagash Little Brett and Blvd Saison Brett. At $6 a bottle, its at the upper end of what I am willing to pay again.
user_location: HdG (past: NYC, KS, Rain City), Maryland, USA

text:
UPDATED: APR 27, 2017 Imbottigliata a maggio 2016, aperta il 13 novembre 2016.
Dorata carica tendente allarancio, velata dai lieviti, schiuma bianca imponente, fine e appiccicosa, di eccellente persistenza.
Aroma di ananas, pesca, banana fresca, leggera pera, lieve pompelmo, cuoio, zucchero candito, note di crisantemo.
Al palato parte con ananas, uva bianca e zucchero candito, di seguito pompelmo e cuoio, finale amaro resinoso con pompelmo accompagnato da crosta di pane, erbaceo, crisantemo ed una nota di menta fresca.
Retrolfatto di ananas, crisantemo e stallatico.
Corpo medio, mediamente carbonata, bevuta davvero notevole.

Sample glass at Stanislaus Brewkovich during on the friday tastings in Enschede. sample from 33 cl bottle.
Appearance: Golden body with a small thick white head. 
AROMA: Funk, pineaplle, a bit of vinious tones, loight sour hints. 
Taste: Funky Brett, barnyard and Hops. A fruity pallet of Pineaplle, red fruits and green apples and apricots. Very nice balance between sweet, bitter and some funky sour tones. Dry Finish has a gentle hoppy bitterness.Overall quite fruity 
Below average body, and sparkling carbonation ( But not annoying as it works with the taste palate !) 

Nice one, really fruity Belgian ale, with some good hops and some good brett implementation.

Huge yellow head, utterly stable, over fully hazy orange-ochre beer, lively carbonated. Bretts jumping out of the glass, floormop variety not excluded. Amandine sweet, typical Brett funky flavours, fruitsweets and old malts. Very well-carbonated, spritzy; medium bodied at best. The more I taste, the more Im convinced the secret of lambic is the cascade of yeasts, not the Brett...

Bottle at Dunkbar. Cloudy golden with a big white head. Big funky aroma with grapefruit, leather, barnyard and horseblanket along with herbal notes. Dry and funky flavour. A little more dirty, but also more complex than the very young Orval I have for comparison. Its awesome, but I think I still prefer the complex, cleaner old Orval...
Bottle at a brewery. Intense rich and harmonic bretty character of barnyard and bubblegum. Almost no sourness, only clean funk. Interesting and tasty. High carbonation.
Bottle at brewery. Gold color,color with thick white head. Sour aroma with apples, vinous notes. Taste, sour, apples, vinous, Brett, so, tropical fruits. Nice bitterness in finish.

Fľaa pivovar. Tmavia zlatá farba, biela slabá pena. Vôňa sladová, tropické ovocie, prezreté slivky, jemná kyselkavosť, brettky. Chuť sladová, kyselkavo-octová, jemne tropické ovocie, citrusové tóny, brettky. Stredné telo, stredná nasýtenosť, veľmi ľahko piteľné. Dlhá príjemná dochuť.
On tap at brewery. Pours golden color, white head. Aroma of funk, brett. Taste is medium sweet, medium hoppy, funky, malty, brett, some tropical fruits.
Pours a hazy amber body with a thick head. Very nice funky aroma of brett. Taste is funky with a nice carboration and a subtle bitterness at the end.
Sample at SBWF. Pours hazy yellow with white head. Sweet aroma with notes of honey. Drinkable.
Bottle bought at Geers Oostakker. Very light body, high oxidation, dry and light oaky. Not really my thing.

Bottle from Hops & crafts Exeter. Pours slightly hazy golden orange with a big off white head. Aroma vintage cider,tart apple ,citrus & red berry fruits. Taste is basically the same ciders with more berry fruit good dryness & tart/sourness. Light bodied tart & dry the long finish is full of red berries,tart apple(cider) &more tartness. Would really prefer a good cider!

Robe ambrée orange cuivré de trouble à opaque. Mousse blanche très très légèrement cassé. Aspect meringué, assez compact. Dentelle sur le verre. Nez fruité, vineux, doux avec des notes discrètes de houblon floral. Bouche douce soyeuse qui révèle les fruits (ananas, mangue), la levure Brett avec des fulgurances boisées de lambic ou de Rode bruin. Notes de foin. Malt toasté en support. Fin de bouche moyenne qui révèle une amertume contrôlée. Carbonatation forte, bulles désordonnées sur la langue. Texture assez huileuse. Bien fort ronde et complexe. Un voyage plein descales.

Bottle from Deconinck, Vichte - BE. Color: hazy cloudy blond beer with medium carbonation and medium white foam. Smell: grassy and herbal yeast. Brett explosion but really well balanced. Taste: medium body with good malt backbone, grassy and saison yeast with brett notes. Hays and grass. Very nice. Superb balance. Aftertaste: astringent, hay and grassy. Brett.

UPDATED: FEB 23, 2017  Rami Rami is drinking a Bruxellensis by Brasserie de la Senne at Konstruktorska Business CenterBardziej dziki i goryczjowy orval. Brety w strone skory i apteki, sporo przypraw, owoce brzoskwinia banan. Ryli ok, tylko apteka za bardzo Ocena potraktowana skryptem do przeliczania ocen (uzgodnienie UT/RB).

Bottle (Feb 2016 bottling). Head is initially large, frothy/creamy, off-white, fully lasting. Body is hazy medium amber, bottle conditioned. Aroma is lightly to moderately malty (toasted grain, cookie), moderately hoppy (herbs, apricot, flowers, grapefruit, resin), lightly to moderately yeasty (cobwebs, barnyard), with notes of plastic (pool toys! and plastic bags), dried papaya, clove, gum, cinnamon. Flavor is moderately sweet, lightly to moderately acidic, lightly to moderately bitter. Finish is lightly sweet, lightly to moderately acidic, moderately bitter. Medium body, velvety texture, lively carbonation, lightly alcoholic.

Did you like Green Flash Rayon Vert, but were bummed when it was effectively discontinued almost as soon as it came out? Well, this little numbers got your back, friend-o. Its a bit like Orval, but to me more like Rayon Vert, with more fruity and plastic notes than Orval usually has. Dry and bitter, but with more residual sugar than Orval (and a bit less than Rayon Vert had). And like both, an appearance to die for...clumpy, sticky, beautiful head that lasts forever. The only thing keeping this from 4+ territory is the strong plastic odor that distracts me from the nice things...have had it twice now (once at Holy Grale and once now in my rental house), and both times that doggone pool toys plastic note just keeps me from falling in love with it. Which is a shame because its otherwise almost at the level of Rayon Vert and Orval.

UPDATED: MAY 24, 2017 Bottled Feb. 11, 2016

Slightly hazed orange. Lathery mountain of white meringue hangs around for an eternity. Extraordinarily soft and bright nose of plaster, almond skin, dried papaya, pepper, medical tape, horseblanket, hay fields, black tea. Very subtle note of melanoidins (browned shortbread), cookie and lactic acid. Fluffy mouthfeel. A remarkably soft and stunningly integrated surge of papaya, rich flower nectar and pillowy maltiness captivates on initial sip. Honey-drenched tropical fruits exhibit a deep, oozing sappiness that elegantly clings to all pockets of the palate and induces a deluge of saliva. Buoyant haylike malt cradles the peppery, but well-integrated, tealike hops and complements the subtle lactic twang with an understated complexity, maintaining a delightfully fluffy base throughout which evokes an expansiveness akin to steamy white cake. Dabs of snappy cookie and almond skin supply structure. Well-measured push of peppery phenols and cottony brett cleanses the palate with a profound "airiness", which vivifies the masterfully extracted malt and squeaky-clean attenuation. Malt is seemingly weightless, yet somehow satiating at the same time as its plentitude of soft and succulent textures pervade the palate with a host of gently sweet toasty and cookielike intricacies. Brett-derived sherbety notes line the body with tremendous brightness and just enough fruit-laced sturdiness, which builds on the lustrous fruity esters in the juicy center. Very balanced and clean finish reveals a woody, peppery, and bitterly herbaceous hop grip capped with drying horseblanket and brisk phenolics. Another audaciously hoppy charmer from Yvan and co., comprised of all the yeasty nuance and malty elegance one could possibly ask for, two features that so few brewers are capable of attaining these days. The clumpy white meringue and creamy mouthfeel is just a bonus. The brett brux strain is on full display here, and the end result here is a beer thats every bit as impressive as the sublime batches of Orval.
user_location: Blue Ridge Mountains, North Carolina, USA

text:
Pourquoi me suis-je procurer cette bière ? Rien que son nom et son sous-titre mavait fait faire la moue . Mais jaime tellement le travail de la brasserie de la Senne que je me suis dit que ce serait peut-être différent avec eux, et jai voulu essayer. Erreur !! le verre confirme que même avec eux, du
vinaigre cest du vinaigre  et comme disent les vieux bruxellois : "quand on pisse acide, on ne pisse pas du sucre !!!" 
Donc, foi de "local brett beer", on va semmerder ferme 
Et quand je pense que mon exemplaire est proposé jusquen 2021 .. eh bien, je vous dis, je ne serai
pas au rendez-vous ...
Couleur ambre pâle, à la clarté nette (malgré une saturation du diable à louverture ..).
Bulles fines en colonnes droites, vives, qui montrent que lon est bien chez la Senne.
Mousse beige claire, soyeuse, stable à 3 mm.
Arômes de lambic doux, fût de vin du Roussillon, raisin en botrytis.
1ère bouche douce très typée lambic, mais avec latténuation dune ambrée.
Arrière-bouche nettement sur laigre.
2ème avec une mélange vin et aigre, ce qui en français donne "vinaigre".
Arrière-bouche avec un peu de fût, mais laigre domine...
Attention, lencensoir sarrête ici .. Après cest le rouleau à tarte à Mami qui prend le relais 
On ne trouve plus rien, sauf une tête sur laquelle taper un bon coup de rouleau 
Bref, cest lamentable et désespérant.
CONCLUSION : vous voulez une conclusion ?
Lovely hazy orange colour. Thin white head. Aroma is quite a bit of fresh bread and some wet grass. Taste is citric forward with a subtle bitterness.

Offert par Nutjes.
Bouteille de 33 cl.
Couleur tire entre lextra blond et le cuivrée.
Mousse ferme et abondante.
Au nez, note de levure fraiche et sauvage mais aussi acidité type fruit ( citron ?)
En bouche, acidé présente peu etre bien dun fruit clémentine ? citron ?
Mais aussi acidité type gueuze ? 
gout de levure présent , note de fruit tropical excellent qui termine sur une fin plutôt sec .

Bottle at home in London - picked up at the Bottle Shop, Bermondsey. Pours lightly hazed gold with a fluffy, white head. Ample brett in the snout, with light poopy aspect, some ripe lemon, farm, moist hay. Light to medium sweet flavour with some wheat bread, melon, tangerine, a bit of bretty funk, some apple, moderate acidity. Medium bodied with active carbonation. Finishes with light alcohol warmth, some musty hay, mellow dryness, apple skins, some pale grains, tangerine, orange rind. Really good stuff. Might age pretty well, too.

Super large head. Very Belgian in all the good ways, yeasty character, brett, toasty, bubbly, full of flavour. Super Yummy taste, funky, spicy, peppery. A real bitter bite. Great stuff even though it cant quite reach the very high heights of the Mont Saleve brett beer colab. But really great. (33cl bottle from Être Gourmet)

[9/26/16] Bottle at Gollem in Antwerpen. Hazy golden. Lovely funky aroma, fruity, floral, earthy. Dry flavor, mildly tart, fruity, floral, earthy, spicy, with a bitter finish. Lively carbonation. Very nice.
From bottle, poured a hazy golden colour with a white head. Nose of grains, light malt, yeast, funky brett notes, lemons, and soft citrus. Reminds me a lot to orval. Lovely

Bottle. Picked up in Brussels, from a shop I cant remember the name of. Very hazy, dark yellow gold. Streams of fine bubbles makes for a thick, dense, lasting, white head. Nose has clean, lemony brett. Pineapple notes. Dry grain. Touch of vanilla. Bit of unripe pear. Taste is vanilla sweet, initially, getting dry, bretty and funky. Soft, massaging mouthfeel. Bit of black pepper spice. Finishes bretty, funky and lightly spicy. Some hop bitterness on the close. Beautifully balanced. Lovely.
Bottle at Nialls. Pours golden orange, nose lemon, funky , zesty, taste is dry, funky brett, tart.

Draught sample at SBWF.
Orange, thick white head, hazy.
Aroma of fresh apricot, taste bitter, sour, tart feel, some sweetness.

Bottle, 33cl, Dranken Geers. Pours hazy orange/copper. Shiny large bubble head, very similar to Orval in that. Brett & lemonpeel nose, but not too much. Aroma is passion and citrusfruit. Palate is very mellow. Taste is mostly bitter with a subtle sourness. Not tart. Dry finish. Good.
Sample @ SBWF. Fresh and hoppy with heavy citrus notes. A bit dry. A unusually light and drinkable brettbeer.

Bottle sample at Sbwf. 
Pours amber. 
Aroma of licorice. 
Balanced, bitter and tart.

Bottle at the BA Belgian Fest on 9/17/16.Good clarity, with a slight haze and honey-amber color with a large, off-white head with strong retention.Brett is quite tart and perfumey here, with lots of floral character, minimal citrus and not really much in the way of band-aid. A good dose of malt sweetness creeps in, with light caramel and honey balancing the acids. Definitely fruity, as the commercial description indicates, with an enjoyable, bright pineapple and nectarine character that lingers on the end, alongside light pepper and hickory notes from the brett. No alcohol or flaw. Maybe a touch of grainy, bare specialty malt, but otherwise quite nice.In the mouth the malt wraps itself about the brett as I get a sense of strong caramel-like malt notes, though not overly sweet, easily balancing the peppery-floral brett character with a lingering pineapple-lime-hickory character that is quite interesting. Light hop bitterness and a touch of spicy, moderately ctiric juiciness from the hops, complementing the fruitiness. Tight carbonation, very soft texture, though the acids and light graininess from the specialty malt keep it from being too sweet or mushy, if you will. Innovative and fun and good to see theres still more to be done with brett pale ales.

Gushing przy otwieraniu. Piana obfita, mydlana, trwała. Barwa pomarańczowo złota, lekko mętna, piwo mocno "gazuje w szkle". Aromaty ewidentnie brettowe, dzikie, jest skóra, stajnia, siano, do tego trochę suszonych moreli, kandyzowanej skórki pomarańczy, jasnych dojrzałych winogron, karbidu... W smaku półsłodkie, powtórka tego co w zapachu, ale ze zdwojoną intensywnością, dodatkowo pojawia się pikantność przyprawowa, nieduża głogowa goryczka, rodzynki i białe wino w posmaku. Wysycenie dość wysokie, drobne, półpełne w odbiorze.

Bardzo intensywne, charakterne piwo, mocno funky, mocno dzikie, estrowe i fenolowe, a przy tym bardzo dobre i zdecydowanie dla sympatyków brettów.
Bottle @ Boys Night out at the Hill of the dragon. Pours Dark hazy orange with a white head. Funky dry brett! Very clean. A tad of orange peel. Funky fresh with a dry and bitter finish.
Bottle @ Boys night out at the Hill Of The Dragon. Hazy orange body with a small white head. Yeast, apricot, hops, funky, brett, dry, bitter. Lovely.

Bottle @ Boys night out, at the hill dragon. Pours hazy amber with a white head. Aroma of Brett, foral, tangerine, clean latic acid, barn. Taste is mango, quite nutty from the Brett, candied orange, ripe mango. Clean and easy.

Flaska från Etre Gourmete. Disig, bärnstensfärgad med hög skumluva som långsamt sjunker ihop. Fantastisk doft med massor av brett, stall och hästfilt men även friska äpplen, ananas och citrus. Smaken levererar vad doften lovat, massor av funk, friskt aningen syrlig, krispig och med en citrusbeska som stramar upp smaken fint. Massor av karaktär, fantastiska smaker och perfekt balans. Det tar emot att säga det men den slår nog faktiskt Orval. Gudomligt gott.

Bottle from Ledgers. It pours a clear, rich golden color with a large foamy/rocky off white head. The aroma is certainly brett forward with some detergent, wet hay, basement, pineapple, peach and distant notes of flowers. The flavor has some toasted malt, flowers, leather, grape, pineapple, hints of bubblegum, spicy/floral bitterness and really strong depth of funk. The body is frothy and it has some nice dry maltiness underneath all the yeast character. The finish is bone dry, funky and very bitter. A bit reminiscent of Orval.

bottled on 11/2/16 
Leggero ambrato torbida buona nota funky agrume buona secchezza buon amaro piuttosto gasata
Bottle at cerveteca Lisboa Portugal. Hazy gold color. Head is medium and white. Taste is light sweet, medium bitter, light sour. Aroma is fruit, herb, spices, leaves.

33cl bottle. Hazy light amber with a nice white head. Brett, citrus, spices, apricot and honey in the aroma. Average carbonation and medium body. Taste is complex with funk, sweet and bitter notes. Dry finish. Overall, a good beer.

Bottle, [email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ Gourmet. Pours clear orange golden with a large, staying creamy white head. Aroma has funk, leather, light caramel, apples. Medium carbonation, fine dry very creamy mouthfeel. Flavour has fabulous funk, esters, caramel, strawberries, doughy, leather. Solid grapefruit and grassy bitterness. Absolutely lovely.

330 ml bottle from Etre Gourmet, bottled 11 Feb 16.
Medium gusher. Amber, hazy body, with a big, fluffy, strongly lacing, white head.
Lovely aroma, lots of Brett, citrus, lemongrass, apricot, candy, some sweet bread, some dried fruits, some spices, slight cheese.
Taste is dry and bitter, with Brett, lemon zest, grass, herbs, some spices, some unripe pears.
Medium, oily mouthfeel, with a fizzy carbonation.
Finishes bone-dry, bitter, zesty, funky, with sour fruits, grass, some spices.

The nose is just wonderful, complex und full of lovely Brett and fruit notes. The taste is a bit too harsh for me, very dry and pretty bitter, overlaping most of the fruit notes. Should become smoother with some aging I guess, so I will retry another bottle in a year or two. Overall not my favourite De la Senne, but still a characterful, high-class beer, as always from this great brewery.
Sampled at Van Moll Beer fest. Clear orange golden color, small white head. Smell and taste malts, brett, lightly hay / straw, bitter. Decent body, firm carbonation.
Clear amber colour with a small white head. Smells brett, leathery, sourish. Tastes bretty, sweetish. Way too much carbo, thin body.

Belgian blonde refermented with Brettanomyces bruxellensis (one of the many lambic fermenters) for 4 months. Senne has well understood the importance of local beer culture and terroir in this modern craft beer world, identifying themselves strongly with the Belgian capital, and this is about as Brussels as it gets, I reckon. Off-white, lacing, moussy head, misty orange blonde colour. Fruity and mildly, but unmistakably funky aroma of moldy peach, overripe gooseberry, stale sweat, wet leather, damp hay, turnip, very old white pepper, apricot. Estery onset, lots of typically Belgian gooseberry effect, some green banana and yellow kiwi, medium carbo, mixture of sour and sweet in good balance with each other and very refreshing, supple, lightly bready middle with a slight caramelly hint while sourish berry effects persist, tart finish, drying but gently so, herbal hop bitterness breaking the esters and the malt, but Bretty effects of leather and hay go down with it. Refined, well-balanced, classy and utterly quenching Belgian.

Robe ambrée, mousse abondante, crémeuse, persistante. Nez superbe sur des notes de levures, brett, touche de cerise du nord, fourrure, épices, fruits acidulés, minéralité. Bouche à lattaque acidulée, superbe note épicée et fruitée, fraîcheur, amertume, longueur et équilibre. Une très grande bière belge, jadore

Schitterend oranjekleurig troebel bier met romige witte schuimkraag. Overduidelijk aroma en smaak van de Brettanomyces gist. Verder mango, perzik, abrikoos, beetje banaan. Licht zurig met een zoetje. Heel vol en heel romig in de mond. Top (alweer) van de la Senne !!
Bottle at the Poechenellekelder. Super Bretty taste and aroma. Also usual De La Senne citrus hoppiness but some tropical stuff too. Lightly leathery, nice bubbliness. Great stuff.

UPDATED: OCT 13, 2016 33cl-fles van bij Bierhalle Deconinck te Vichte. U: Wazig goudblond-oranje met grote gebroken witte schuimkraag. G: Mango, brett en een licht citrushoptoets. S: Tropisch fruitig-zoet in de aanzet, licht zuurtje van de brett. Droog en citrusbitter in de afdronk. M: Stevige carbonatie en medium body.

Thank you for sharing! Sampled 330 ml. bottle @ Gents Bierfestival 2016. GUSHER. First time I see a De La Senne beer gushing. Hazy orange, white bubbles. Nose is strange very grainy funk, almost low mushroom, funky cereal, brett, wild honey, dried papaya. Taste is fizzy grain, old cereal, honey, leather, very grainy unusual funk, some mushroom, herbal, faint leather, Lively & very grainy. Very interesting & unusual, a bit hard to describe. A bit too challenging for me to fully love but quite an interesting beer.
Bottle at Moeder Lambic. Love that style really. Yummy fruity brett character, one of Cultivators ancestors maybe :)

Sample from bottle at fofa. Amber pour with light have, thin white head. Aroma is quite bretty, intense leathery, earthy, woody brett, light spice. Taste is sweet, malty caramel like flavors with very spicy brett, leather. Palate is med-full bodied with high carbonation. Decent belgian ale, well made, but a bit too intense for full enjoyment.

Bottle 0.33l at Oedipus Carnivale Brettanomyces 2016 Amsterdam, The Netherlands. 23.06.2016. Pour it hazy orange color with medium white head. Aroma funky,pretty, little bit dusty. Taste citrus, apricots, peach, earthy, some honey, brett present, smooth funky texture, spice, really funky and strange in a good way. Good!

Bottle pour at FoFA. Clear bright dark golden with a medium off-white head, good retention, leaving little lacing. Aroma is of earthy and leathery brettanomyces, peppery yeast, caramel and fruits/peaches. Taste is a bit heavy, quite earthy and leathery brettanomyces forward with caramel malt, cereals, moderate fruitiness (mostly peaches) and peppery/spicy notes. Medium body, heavy for the style. Good carbonation. Leathery and earthy finish. Lack the drinkability beers from this brewery usually have. Strong in-your-face leathery/earthy brettanomyces profile that lacks some refinement. Good, but still a disappointment coming from De la Senne. .

Bouteille 33cl BB 11.02.2021.
Couleur dorée/orange, col épais persistant blanc-cassé.
Arôme au nez offrant de fines effluves de brett qui conferment un fruité délicat rappelant labricot. Retrouve un bouquet retrait malt amber qui oscille sur un fin caramel presque biscuité.
Palais offer in profil axé sur le malté - pale, cara ambre et qui est relevé par les bretts. Retrouve une pointe dépice et une marque de fabrique de DLS au niveau de la base - houblons. Fruité plaisant des bretts, abricot voire raisin blanc et un léger fleuri. Malt reste bien en place sur la fin avec un petit côté biscuité.

15/VII/16 - 33cl bottle from Geers (Oostakker) @ home - BB: 11/II/21, bottled: 11/II/16 (2016-758) 
Slightly hazy orange beer, big fizzy off-white head, pretty stable, bit adhesive, leaving some lacing in the glass. Aroma: lots of fruit candy, peach, bit soapy, little funky. MF: lively carbon, medium body. Taste: bit sourish, funky, pretty bitter, citrus, somewhat sourish. Aftertaste: bitter, peaches, funky, bit yeasty.

Pours rather unclear amber. Big white head ( huge ) smell is brettfunk, dry and Oody aspects even. Taste is Sharp and full Brett. Very clean. Almost one dimentional, but theres a lot going on in the background , making this a very complex beer ! Bit sweetness, obviously the Brett factors, malty, even a bit hoppy , some Candy like ( snoepkesketting ) sweet style of fruityness. Very full , intense. Lovely ! One of the best de la sennes to date !

Tasted from 33 cl. bottle on 23.07.16 @ home in Garden, with Jan Ober en William. 
Hazy dark golden to copper color, with royal off-white head. 
Aroma: bit smoke, some sour, fruits, brett. Medium body. 
Taste: ssmoke, some spice (pepper and other) funky, brett, bitterness.
Good balanced.
WELL DONE ! Nice brew, we like !

Bottle @ Nuetnigenough. So the barman told me that this beer is a result of De La Senne introducing a strain of brett that was isolated from a bottle Cantillon Gueuze into a pale ale. Cool idea. Hazy Amber pour with a rocky white head. Nose is meringue, dried manure, pasture and general countryside. Pepper. Nice brett character evident. Flavor is quite dry moderately bitter. Strong brett and peppered grass dominate. Mild grapefruit. Medium body, strong carbonation. Smells great but the flavor is a little one-dimensional.

Bottle. Hazy golden amber color, fluffy white head with good retention and solid lacing. Aroma of barn corners, attics, and animals sweating in the distance. Taste is funky, dusty, peppery tannins. Delicious.

33cl bottle. Hazy orange with huge white head. The beer has very fresh aromas of fruits like white grapes, apples, some gooseberry, banana. There are also some notes of hay and barnyard in the background. Also white cheese, pepper, clove and cake. Fluffy and soft mouth feel with medium carbonation. The beer is again refreshing with sweet cake notes and some spices, then the bitterness is strong but doesnt last too long to make it unpleasant. The finish is somehow medium long and fruity. A very complex beer yet very refreshing with delicious spicy cake malt background. I could drink that everyday.
Bottle in garden, 3rd July 16. Dark amber. Aroma is funk, Brett, Yeast, pine, honey, spice. Taste is Brett, funk, spice yeast, honey, citrus, some bitter. Lovely

Bottle @ Oedipus, Carnivale Brettanomyces 2016, with Zlotta, Markoijelena and more. Hazy orange color. Off white, rocky and frothy head. Aromas: brett, funk. Less funky retronasal, light sweetness. Flavor is moderate sweet, moderate bitter. Medium bodied. Finishes rather bitter, but not harsh.
Funky, bretty (but not too much), nice copper colour, medium head. I love most De la Senne products, and this one is going in the top 3.

Sampled from 0.33 l bottle at Oedipus, bottled in February 2016. Slightly hazy, orangeish amber with a large, fluffy, slowly diminishing, off-white head. Sourish, a bit funky and quite fruity aroma of peach, grains, some pepper and a bit of honey. Slightly sourish, moderately funky, a bit fruity taste of honey, peach and some grains, followed by a medium long, quite bitter, moderately tart and a bit peppery finish. Medium body, slightly creamy and a bit astringent mouthfeel, soft carbonation. Nice!

UPDATED: JUN 23, 2016 Bootle at Carnivale Brettanomyces #5 in Amsterdam . Funky funky brett taste and smell upfront, with a bitter aftertaste that lasts. Very malty character. Heavyweight beer with heavy taste.

Bottle from Etre Gourmet, Brussels. Slightly hazy golden/copper beer with a nice offwhite head. Fruity barnyard aroma, hay, brett, floral notes. Floral brett flavor, herbal, hay, barnyard notes, some spices. Great one.
